metadata.synopsis: Players can use Speak with Animals to talk to the pigeon at the Post house to find out more information regarding the missing letters. The pigeon will point the player towards the Open Hand Temple roof.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Post_PigeonCptBlackBeak and use SwA to talk to the pigeon.

4.speaker: Pigeon
4.text: Leave me be, ground-walker. I've reports to prepare.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Is there any more intelligence available for this mission?

46.speaker: Pigeon
46.text: You'll want to watch out for the enemy's observation post of course. Tallest point around these parts.

32.speaker: Pigeon
32.text: It used to make a bloody awful racket, but it's fallen silent. No doubt our enemy has claimed the territory.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Sorry Commander. I'll return to my mission.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?

13.speaker: Player
13.text: None of that changes the fact you're only a pigeon.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: It sounds like you've quite the fight on your hands. Or, feathers?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.

47.speaker: Pigeon
47.text: Let's see how tough you are after a taste of real warfare.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Where did you say your enemy was located?

83.speaker: Pigeon
83.text: The rooftop west of here. Look out for the observation tower - tallest thing around these parts.

53.speaker: Pigeon
53.text: You have my thanks. Your service will not be forgotten.
53.context: NodeContext: Uppity, annoyed and in command

62.speaker: Pigeon
62.text: Go on, get out. Before I have you court martialled!
62.context: NodeContext: Uppity, annoyed and in command

63.speaker: Pigeon
63.text: Our headquarters are for serving fliers only. You. Arre. Dismissed!
63.context: NodeContext: Uppity, annoyed and in command

84.speaker: Narrator
84.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

92.speaker: Narrator
92.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *The pigeon carries itself with an air of dignity, its mannerisms stern and commanding.*
113.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

14.speaker: Player
14.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *The pigeon avoids your outstretched hand. It glares at you.*
26.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out a hand. The sound of flapping wings to imply the pigeon moved, the pigeon isn't impressed
[KC] Focus on reaction of pigeon with no player action to lower fidelity

74.speaker: Player
74.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player performs a sweeping bow. Pigeon idling

[KC] Re-use bow contruction or focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *You bow low and graciously, but the pigeon has no appreciation for your courtesy.*
111.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player performs a sweeping bow. Pigeon idling

[KC] Re-use bow contruction or focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

82.speaker: Player
82.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player snaps a smart salute. 

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *The bird coos its approval. Yet you notice it flinched at the sight of your hand.*
41.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player snaps a smart salute. 

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Show your palms to the bird.
39.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player shows their hands to the pigeon (calming gesture, palms out, hands fairly close together - similar to the open-hand temple's sigil). Pigeon flaps/is angry

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *The bird stares, eyes filled with fury. Perhaps your open hands are a symbol the bird has learned to hate.*
72.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player shows their hands to the pigeon (calming gesture, palms out, hands fairly close together - similar to the open-hand temple's sigil). Pigeon flaps/is angry

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Hide your hands behind your back.
104.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player puts their hands behind their back

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *With the offending articles out of sight, the bird is back at ease. No harm done.*
61.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player puts their hands behind their back

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Shake your fist at the bird.
43.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Pigeon doesn't react

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Your threats have no effect. This is an unflappable pigeon.*
40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Pigeon doesn't react

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

93.speaker: Pigeon
93.text: Name and rank? Quickly now - there's a war on.
93.context: NodeContext: This is the most ridiculous thing he's ever heard

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Against the Absolute? I know, I'm fighting in it.
7.context: NodeContext: This is the most ridiculous thing he's ever heard

57.speaker: Pigeon
57.text: The Absolute? Poppycock! Enemy propaganda designed to confuse simple minds.
57.context: NodeContext: This is the most ridiculous thing he's ever heard

10.speaker: Pigeon
10.text: Not your fault you fell for it. You need a strong leader like myself to see the wood under the trees.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I'm hailed as [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53],  ex-overseer of the Cult of Bhaal. Currently on medical leave.
81.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player salutes

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

59.speaker: Player
59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player salutes

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

116.speaker: Pigeon
116.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player salutes

[KC] focus on reaction of the pigeon to lower fidelity

5.speaker: Player
5.context: NodeContext: Outraged, as though yelling at a subordinate

33.speaker: Pigeon
33.text: Squee? SQUEE? I am Commander Lightfeather and you will address me as such.
33.context: NodeContext: Outraged, as though yelling at a subordinate

15.speaker: Pigeon
15.text: The army? Those great, clodding dirt snufflers.

30.speaker: Pigeon
30.text: I am Commander Lightfeather, leader of the finest aerial communication regiment this side of the Chionthar.

88.speaker: Pigeon
88.text: State your purpose, ground-walker. I don't have all day.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.

95.speaker: Pigeon
95.text: I suspected as much. Bloody shame, but that's the nature of war.

22.speaker: Pigeon
22.text: Make your report. How did the battle unfold?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: They died horrible, painful deaths. Blood, guts and feathers all over the place.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: They fought to the last feather against a truly formidable foe.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: They were eaten by a flying cat.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I found letters carried by some of your birds. I'm afraid they didn't make it.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I hear some of your, er, officers have gone missing recently. What happened to them?

77.speaker: Pigeon
77.text: Damned awful business - fine fliers the lot of them, gone without a trace.

87.speaker: Pigeon
87.text: Intelligence is in short supply, but we know our enemy's flanked us on the west side, not one rooftop away.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I found your pigeons. What was left of them, anyway. There was so much blood...

28.speaker: Pigeon
28.text: War's a vile business. But, we fight on! We must deliver!

103.speaker: Pigeon
103.text: As for you, flightless one - it was an honour taking you under my wing. Dismissed!

2.speaker: Pigeon
2.text: Your reconnaissance is appreciated. This information will be vital in deciding our new strategy. Dismissed!

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I found the enemy you're talking about. Your pigeons fought bravely against it.
105.context: NodeContext: Like this is the most insane thing he's ever heard

73.speaker: Pigeon
73.text: Of course they did! No doubt it was my training gave them the discipline and resolve to stay in the fight!

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Ah. I'm afraid my tressym is the enemy responsible.
42.context: NodeContext: Like this is the most insane thing he's ever heard

48.speaker: Pigeon
48.text: A tressym? What nonsense is this? Making up words like a nincompoop.
48.context: NodeContext: Like this is the most insane thing he's ever heard

55.speaker: Pigeon
55.text: I'm putting you on leave until you regain your senses. Dismissed!

98.speaker: Pigeon
98.text: And you dare show your face to me? Have you no honour? No respect for the dead?

102.speaker: Pigeon
102.text: Get out! Never darken the doors of my coop again!

1.speaker: Pigeon
1.text: We're avoiding the whole area. I won't lose one more beak to the blighter.

27.speaker: Pigeon
27.text: If you pass that way, beware the sign of the featherless wings. From that rooftop, none return.

23.speaker: Pigeon
23.text: If you go that way, watch for the bell tower. That's the enemy's observation post.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I'm looking for some letters that weren't delivered. Any idea where I can find them?

18.speaker: Pigeon
18.text: Letters? Ah, you mean the top secret communiqués attached by the tall one.

85.speaker: Pigeon
85.text: If they didn't arrive, no doubt they were attached to one of our recent casualties.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Why does a flock of carrier pigeons need a commander?

16.speaker: Pigeon
16.text: Because! We deliver communications across dangerous enemy territory, with only our superior wits and aerial agility to protect us.

89.speaker: Pigeon
89.text: Even our skills have their limits. We've lost several experienced fliers recently. They knew the risks, but still - damned shame!

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You've got a pretty  high opinion of yourself, for a pigeon.

71.speaker: Pigeon
71.text: A PIGEON? We are WARRIORS, risking life and feather to deliver vital communiqués on a daily basis.

31.speaker: Pigeon
31.text: Do you know how many of us have passed on to the great nest in the sky in service to your kind?

80.speaker: Pigeon
80.text: Fly west of here, to the rooftop of the featherless wings. Face our enemy. Then call me pigeon. Pah!

99.speaker: Pigeon
99.text: Don't make me repeat myself. Name and rank.

112.speaker: Narrator
112.context: NodeContext: Officious, netural tone (pigeon could be annoyed at you, or not, at this point)

118.speaker: Pigeon
118.text: You've returned. Yet my fliers have not. I suppose they've flown this mortal coop, so to speak.
118.context: NodeContext: Officious, netural tone (pigeon could be annoyed at you, or not, at this point)
